meanings.definition: To slide or skid out of place suddenly or unexpectedly.
meanings.sent1: I saw the car slipout on the icy road.
meanings.sent2: Be careful not to slipout on the wet floor.
meanings.sent3: The banana peel made me slipout in a cartoonish way.
meanings.sent4: Her words made my confidence slipout like sand through fingers.
meanings.sent5: The loose shoelace caused him to slipout of balance.

meanings.definition: An instance of sliding or skidding out of place suddenly or unexpectedly.
meanings.sent1: The slipout of the book from the shelf surprised me.
meanings.sent2: The slipout of the puzzle piece delayed our progress.
meanings.sent3: The slipout of the ice cream cone was a messy situation.
meanings.sent4: The slipout of the secret caused chaos in the office.
meanings.sent5: The slipout of the ball from his hand cost them the game.
